business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower in volatile session; small and midcaps gainThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 28.21 points lower at 75,939.18, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 12.40 points lower at 22,932.90.

FIIs continue to dump Indian stocks: What it means for your investment portfolioWith FIIs selling aggressively, smallcaps and midcaps bleeding, and China attracting inflows, here's what retail investors should do.

Tesla likely to set up shop in India, may invest $3-5 billion: Sources During their visit, Tesla executives are expected to hold meetings with officials from the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) and other key ministries.
Small SIP, big returns: Check how Rs 250 a month can grow to Rs 17 lakhSBI Mutual Fund's new JanNivesh SIP is making investing more accessible, letting anyone start with as little as Rs 250 a month.

Reliance is India's most valuable company. Check top 10 firms in Hurun India 500The 2024 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 report values Reliance at Rs 17.5 lakh crore. TCS comes in second at Rs 16.1 lakh crore, and HDFC Bank takes third place with Rs 14.2 lakh crore.

Dr Reddy's, Aurobindo Pharma: Why pharma stocks fell in early trade today?The Nifty Pharma index dropped as much as 2% in early trade. Sun Pharma fell nearly 2%, Dr Reddy's dropped as much as 4%, and Aurobindo Pharma sank almost 6%. Cipla shares also fell.

Tata Motors shares get boost after CLSA upgrade. Check target priceTata Motors share price: At around 11:04 am, shares of Tata Motors were trading 0.34% higher at Rs 683.90 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It was up over 1% in early trade.

Hexaware Technologies shares debut at 5% premium over IPO priceHexaware Technologies IPO listing: The listing was largely in line with expectations, as the grey market premium (GMP) had disappeared ahead of the debut, indicating weak demand.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, pharma stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex shed 291.20 points to 75,676.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.65 points to 22,856.65 as of 9:25 AM.

Quality Power IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Quality Power IPO allotment status: Investors who applied for the Quality Power IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or the registrar's website (Link Intime India Private Ltd).

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Unified Pension Scheme to roll out from April 1. Check eligibility and benefitsUnder the new pension scheme, government employees will contribute 10% of their basic salary along with DA, while the government's contribution will rise from the previous 14% to 18.5%.

entertainment.headline: Melo Movie review: A slow-burn, mature drama that will stay with youReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Melo Movie released in Netflix on February 14. Starring Choi Woo-shik and Park Bo-young, the 10-episode-show deals with love, loss, and grief.

New Matthew Perry documentary promises to dig deep into the Hollywood tragedyA new Matthew Perry documentary called Matthew Perry: A Hollywood Tragedy will be out later this month, wherein the makers will investigate the untimely death of the Friends star.

The First Frost review: Love, trauma, longing - new Chinese drama delivers it all Released-Thu Feb 20, 2025The First Frost review: This Chinese drama delves into the complexities of love, trauma, and longing, offering a poignant narrative that diverges from typical romance tropes. With its melancholic visuals and dual perspectives, it explores the tangled history between its protagonists, making it a compelling watch.

Uorfi Javed's mother on her bold fashion: Was shocked at first, but I support herUorfi Javed revealed her mother was the first in their family to try Botox. Her mother also recalled her reaction when she saw Uorfi's "new style".

Suzhal 2 trailer: Kathir takes on gripping murder mystery with Aishwarya RajeshThe official trailer of the highly-anticipated second season of the Tamil crime thriller Suzhal - The Vortex was released on Wednesday. Starring Kathir and Aishwarya Rajesh in lead roles, the series will premiere on Prime Video on February 28.

Rihanna 'thankful, humbled' after A$AP Rocky found not guilty in shooting caseA$AP Rocky was declared not guilty in a felony assault trial, leading to an emotional embrace with Rihanna in court. After the verdict, the singer issued her first statement, expressing relief.

Retro hits to soulful music: Magical evening at Papon's Valentine's Day special showPapon's concert in Delhi, hosted by TV9, was an unforgettable night filled with soulful music. Held at Major Dhyan Chand National Stadium, the event was part of the World Travel and Tourism Festival.

Watch: Arijit Singh attends father's video call during live concertArijit Singh's live concert in Chandigarh was made memorable by a surprise video call from his father during his performance. The singer shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude to his fans.

Pics: Singer Anuv Jain married, shares photos with wifeSinger Anuv Jain, popular for songs like Baarishein, is now married. He shared photos from the wedding and pre-wedding festivities on social media.

Singer Akhil Sachdeva on Diljit Dosanjh's infrastructure remark: I feel it's amazingSinger Akhil Sachdeva discusses the rise of concerts in India, film vs indie music, ticket prices, and Diljit Dosanjh's comments on concert infrastructure. He also stresses the importance of crediting technicians.

K-slate 2025: When Life Gives You Tangerine to Wife of a 21st Century PrinceKakao Entertainment is set to make 2025 a landmark year for K-dramas and films, with a rich array of releases across various genres. From gripping thrillers to heartwarming romances, the lineup promises stellar performances and captivating stories.

Dabba Cartel trailer: Shabana Azmi, Jyotika promise an addictive showThe trailer for Netflix's Dabba Cartel unveils a gripping crime drama about five women whose dabba business unexpectedly plunges them into the dangerous world of a drug cartel.

general news.headline: Rekha Gupta: BJP gives Delhi a She MRekha Gupta, who clinched victory in Shalimar Bagh by a margin of 29,595 votes, is the next Delhi Chief Minister.

Who is Rekha Gupta, and why BJP chose her Delhi CMThe BJP has picked Rekha Gupta, a three-time councillor, as the Chief Minister of Delhi. In picking Gupta, who started her political career with the Delhi University Students Union elections, the BJP has tried to cement a legacy and convey a message to its women voter base.

Yogi Adityanath says Mohammad Shami took dip at Kumbh, Akhilesh Yadav reactsYogi Adityanath said that people from all caste and religion were welcomed at Kumbh and claimed that even cricketer Mohammad Shami took the ritual bath.

PAK vs NZ LIVE: Babar Azam unable to provide any impetus in chasePakistan vs New Zealand, Champions Trophy Live score: Pakistan have lost their third wicket with injured Fakhar Azam going back to the dug out after the dismissals of Saud Shakeel and Mohamamd Rizwan. Babar Azam is at the crease but has not been able to counterattack the opposition bowlers.

The $21-million USAID joke, and it isn't on IndiaUSAID used $21 million of American taxpayer money to boost voter turnout in India, according to Elon Musk's DOGE. India has been spending more on elections than the US and sees a better voter turnout too. That's the $21-million joke. On a serious note, the money could have been used to interfere in India's electoral process.

Trump in disinformation bubble: Zelenskyy, snubbed for Ukraine peace talksUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky dismissed Donald Trump's claims about his approval ratings, accusing the US President of being trapped in a Russian 'disinformation bubble'.

Where is the crowd? Vaughan, fans react to empty seats for Champions Trophy openerMichael Vaughan and fans were left stunned as the turnout for the first match of the Champions Trophy 2025 between Pakistan and New Zealand was poor. Empty seats have been visible during the match.

Politics, not science, kept Sunita Williams, other astronaut stuck in space: MuskSpaceX and DOGE chief Elon Musk has accused former US President Joe Biden of leaving two astronauts, Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, stranded in space for "political reasons". In an interview with Fox News alongside former President Donald Trump, Musk said their return to earth had been postponed to a "ridiculous degree".

Video: Athlete dies after 270-kg weight falls on her neck during training at gymA national-level weightlifter, Yashtika Acharya, died after 270-kg weight she was trying to lift fell on her neck during training at a gym in Rajasthan's Bikaner.

Trump recalls tough tariff talks with PM Modi: He goes, 'I don't like that'Donald Trump, recalling his conversation with PM Narendra Modi, said he made it clear that the US would impose reciprocal tariffs even as the PM said "I don't like that".

We only have 2 spinners: Rohit Sharma hits back criticism over squad selectionIndia opting to carry 5 spinners in their Champions Trophy squad has attracted criticism. One day before their opener vs Bangladesh, captain Rohit Sharma has hit back at the critics.

Karnataka Lokayukta's clean chit to Siddaramaiah, his wife in Muda caseKarnataka Lokayukta cleared Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, his wife, and two others, in the Muda site allocation case, citing lack of criminal evidence in the probe.
What is secondary infertility, and why is it rising in IndiaSecondary infertility is on the rise in India but is seldom discussed. Lack of awareness is the reason why it is still a lesser-known term.

'President Musk', Trump's 'tech support': Bromance shines in Musk-Trump interviewMusk-Trump interview: The interview shone light on the camaraderie and bromance between the duo, with Elon Musk labelling himself the President's 'tech support' and Trump calling the Tesla CEO a 'brilliant guy'.
Tesla is coming to India. Here is how Anand Mahindra plans to deal with competitionTesla will reportedly commence sales operations in India in the next three months.

Why tickets were sold beyond limit? Court raps Railways over Delhi stampedeThe Delhi High Court ordered the Railways to examine the fixing of maximum passengers and the sale of platform tickets. This comes after 18 people were killed in a stampede at the New Delhi railway station on February 15.

Google opens new office Ananta in Bengaluru, here is your first look at itGoogle has opened its latest and one of its biggest office spaces globally in Bengaluru, named Ananta. With space for 5,000 employees, the campus reflects India's growing role in Google's global operations.

Shivaji's daring Agra escape that humiliated Aurangzeb and cemented Maratha legacyOn Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's birth anniversary, we recount his daring escape from Aurangzeb's Agra captivity in 1666 -- a masterstroke that strengthened his legend. His guerrilla tactics, administrative reforms, and naval strategy helped build the Maratha Empire, defying Mughal dominance.

Only 4 Indian institutes in global reputation rankings, IISc tops in IndiaIISc, IIT Delhi, and IIT Madras have slipped in THE World Reputation Rankings 2025, while IIT Bombay has dropped out. Harvard remains number one globally.

If India spent $21 million on US poll turnout...: Fox News flags double standardsFox News flagged the US's double standards over its definition of 'election interference' amid a raging debate over Trump's decision to cancel $21 million for 'voter turnout' in India.

Watch: Jack Whitehall trolls Mercedes boss Toto Wolff over Lewis HamiltonComedian Jack Whitehall decided to troll Mercedes boss Toto Wolff because of Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari ahead of the new F1 2025 season. Hamilton spent 12 years with Mercedes before his move to Ferrari.

Sangam water fit for drinking: Yogi Adityanath rejects faecal bacteria reportMaha Kumbh 2025: The remark by Adityanath comes amid a row over a Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) report that found alarming levels of 'faecal coliform' bacteria in the Ganga in Prayagraj.

BJP yet to announce Delhi Chief Minister, tomorrow's oath invite already outThe BJP that won in Delhi after 27 years, is set to end the suspense over the new Chief Minister today when it announces the name in its legislative party meeting.

Video: 1 dead, 10 injured after Kumbh returnees' car crashes into parked bus in UPA high-speed traveller carrying devotees from Maharashtra and Karnataka returning from the Maha Kumbh Mela crashed into a parked bus in Fatehpur.

Sudipto Sen brings Charak, an unsettling story of blind faith in Bengal | ExclusiveDirector Sudipto Sen, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, talked about his upcoming film, 'Charak'. He discussed the dark theme of the film, and answered if it is a hundred per cent honest portrayal.

Kichcha Sudeep's long-delayed Billa Ranga Baasha to go on floors in MarchKichcha Sudeep, who is currently busy with Celebrity Cricket League 2025, shared a major update about his next film Billa Ranga Baasha on social media.

New Matthew Perry documentary promises to dig deep into the Hollywood tragedyA new Matthew Perry documentary called Matthew Perry: A Hollywood Tragedy will be out later this month, wherein the makers will investigate the untimely death of the Friends star.

Mohanlal announces new film, calls it a subject close to his heartAmid anticipation for L2: Empuraan, actor Mohanlal announced a new film which will be directed by actor-director Anoop Menon. The film, produced by Timeless Movies, promises an emotional journey.

sports.headline: India vs Bangladesh: Champions Trophy clash complete guideChampions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma and India would be looking to get off to a winning start when they face Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh on Thursday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Explained: Why Fakhar Zaman didn't open against New Zealand Champions Trophy: Fakhar Zaman came out to bat at No.4 in Pakistan's clash against New Zealand at the National Stadium in Karachi. The left-handed batter sustained an injury in the very first over of the match.

They spoke about the challenges faced by Pakistan cricket after the bus attack on the Sri Lankan team in 2009 which had led to international cricket coming to a halt in the Asian country.

Shanto gives blunt responseChampions Trophy 2025: Skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto gave a one-word response after being asked if Shakib Al Hasan's absence would affect Bangladesh in the tournament. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
